info.title: Chainabuse API
info.description:
The API uses Basic Authentication to authenticate requests. You can generate a new API key from your user profile on Chainabuse.

Once you have an API key, you have three options to authenticate:

  • Click the green Authorize button at the top of the docs, and add your API key as the username (you can leave password blank). In this case, you will be authenticated against all API calls in the docs during your session.
  • Attempt an API call from your browser window and have your browser pop up a native Username/Password window. API key again goes in the username field (you can leave password blank).
  • Using curl, you can supply the api key as username (you can leave password blank) for basic auth. For example, if your api key is ca_YlY1SnZsRWg4S0U0R0p5NG1TekR0Y251LjE2Tjc2OGFENnI2T0hhNzFYalFNUEE9PQ, then you can run curl https://api.chainabuse.com/v0/reports --user ca_YlY1SnZsRWg4S0U0R0p5NG1TekR0Y251LjE2Tjc2OGFENnI2T0hhNzFYalFNUEE9PQ: to get the list of reports.

trusted.description: Reported by a contributor registered as trusted on Chainabuse.

parameters.description: (Optional if a domain is passed). Crypto addresses to screen.
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Optional. Threshold date to use as a filter.
parameters.name: before

parameters.description: Optional. Scam category to use as filter.
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: (Optional if a URL is passed). Chain to use as filter.
parameters.name: chain

parameters.description:
Optional
- True: report checked by our team of moderators including blockchain intelligence experts.
- False: report could not be verified by our team of moderators.
parameters.name: checked

parameters.description:
Optional. An ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code e.g. AE for United Arab Emirates, CA for Canada, GB for United Kingdom, etc.
- Usage: ?country=CA to filter reports within Canada
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: (Optional if an address is passed). URL to screen.
parameters.name: domain

parameters.description:
Optional. Defaults to false. Only users with TRM_INTERNAL role can toggle.
- True: private reports are included in the response.
- False: private reports are hidden from the response.
parameters.name: includePrivate

parameters.description: Optional. Filters reports with at least the amount passed (Currently, only usd asset are supported and others will be ignored).
parameters.name: minLossAmount

parameters.description:
- ASC = latest reports first
- DESC= oldest report first if several reports are pulled out
parameters.name: orderByDirection

parameters.description: Orders reports by date if several reports are pulled out
parameters.name: orderByField

parameters.description: Optional. Number of pages of reports to pull out. The maximum number of reports per page is 50. If page =1, you will pull out a maximum of 50 reports.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Optional. Number of reports to display per page. The maximum number of reports per page is 50. If page =1, you will pull out a maximum of 50 reports.
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: Optional. Filters reports based on passed indicator of compromise.
parameters.name: scammerIoc

parameters.description: Optional. Start date to use as a filter.
parameters.name: since

parameters.description:
Optional
- True: reported by a trusted contributor, based on how this Partner detects and verifies information.
- False: the reporter is not registered as a trusted contributor. Please note this does not mean their report cannot be trusted.
parameters.name: trusted

trusted.description: Reported by a contributor registered as trusted on Chainabuse.

post.description:
Create one or more reports to alert the space on malicious addresses and/or domains.

You can pass a markdown string for the `description` field. We support the following subset of the [markdown language](https://spec.commonmark.org/0.30/):
- Normal text: `"text"`
- Bold: `"**bold text**"`
- Italic: `"*italicized text*"`
- Strikethrough: `"~~strikethrough text~~"`
- Normal heading: `"### heading\n"`
- Small heading: `"#### heading\n"`
- Bullet list: `"- item\n- second item\n"`
- Numbered list: `"1. item\n2. second item\n"`
- Links: `"[link text](https://example.com)"`

losses.description: Optional. List of lost assets and their amounts.

get.description: Chainabuse is deprecating its Sanctions API. TRM provides a similar Sanctions API for free, at the same speed. You can use it [here](http://docs.sanctions.trmlabs.com/). For any questions please contact [hello@chainabuse.com](mailto:hello@chainabuse.com).
